item.title: Journalists imprisoned in Belarus and Georgia win EU’s top human rights award
item.description: Two journalists, one imprisoned in Belarus and the other in Georgia, have won the European Union’s top human rights honor, the Sakharov Prize, European Parliament President Roberta Metsola announced on Wednesday. Andrzej Poczobut is a correspondent for the influential Polish newspaper Gazeta

item.title: DMP files 1,658 cases against traffic rule violations
item.description: The Traffic Division of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police (DMP) has filed 1,658 cases against motor vehicles, their owners, and drivers for violating traffic rules in a single day across the capital. A media release of the DMP on Wednesday said that they filed those cases and realized the money on Tue

item.title: Al-Arafah Islami Bank signs Strategic Partnership with Shamadhan Services Limited
item.description: Al-Arafah Islami Bank PLC, the country’s leading Shariah-compliant financial institution has signed a Strategic Partnership Agreement with Shamadhan Services Limited, a concern of Grameen Telecom, to strengthen digital financial services and enhance customer convenience. The signing ceremony

item.title: Dengue: 2 die, 762 hospitalised
item.description: Another two patients have died of dengue fever in Bangladesh over the past 24 hours, pushing the nationwide death toll this year to 255. The Directorate General of Health Services (DGHS) bulletin released on Wednesday said the latest victims included one woman and one man. They all died in Mugda

item.title: Govt issues new guidelines for eco-friendly tourism on St. Martin’s Island
item.description: The government has issued new guidelines to promote eco-friendly tourism on St. Martin’s Island, aiming to preserve the island’s unique natural beauty, environment, and biodiversity. The Environment-2 Wing of the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change issued a notification

item.title: Jamaat delegation reaches Jamuna to hold talks with chief adviser
item.description: A four-member Jamaat delegation has arrived at Jamuna, the official residence of Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus, to hold talks with him. The delegation entered Jamuna at 5:45 pm on Wednesday. The members of the delegation are Amir Syed Abdullah Mohammad Taher, Secretary General Mia Golam Parwar, As

item.title: Standard Chartered, CAMPE launch ‘Shikhya Shurokkha’ to curb dropout and strengthen rural education
item.description: Standard Chartered Bangladesh and the Campaign for Popular Education (CAMPE) have signed an agreement to launch Shikhya Shurokkha, a community-based initiative aimed at reducing school dropout rates, providing access to online learning resources, and improving learning outcomes in rural and margina

item.title: AB Bank inaugurates 23 New Agent outlets
item.description: AB Bank Limited virtually inaugurated 23 new Agent Banking outlets today, further strengthening its outreach across the country. Managing Director & CEO Mr. Syed Mizanur Rahman formally announced the opening of these new outlets during a virtual inauguration ceremony held at the Bank’s Head

item.title: Customs House, Dhaka to remain open on Oct 24, 25
item.description: The Customs House, Dhaka will remain open on October 24 and 25 (Friday and Saturday) to ensure smooth continuation of import, export, and business operations during the post-disaster interim period. According to an office order issued, all customs assessment teams under the jurisdiction of Customs

item.title: Bengal Commercial Bank hosts 'Closing Ceremony' of month-long 'Entrepreneurship Development Program'
